TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CharConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert Unicode character objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a string, with a length of 1, to and from a character.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.CharConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
## Examples The following code example converts a variable of type <xref:System.Char> to a string variable, and vice versa.
[!code-cpp[Converters#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CPP/converters.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[Converters#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CS/converters.cs#5)] [!code-vb[Converters#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/VB/converters.vb#5)]

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A that represents the type you want to convert from.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object in the given source type to a Unicode character object using the specified context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a string, with a length of 1, to and from a character.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

Docs.summary: Converts the given object to a Unicode character object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a string, with a length of 1, to and from a character.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

Docs.exception: is not a valid value for the target type.
